IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SUPPORT FOR HOSPICE SERVICES IN WHATCOM COUNTY AND THE SURROUNDING AREA.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ASSIST THE PUBLIC IN GAINING ACCESS TO APPROPRIATE HOSPICE CARE, SUPPORT HOSPICE EDUCATION, AND TO PROVIDE FOR UNDER REIMBURSED CARE, BEREAVEMENT, THERAPIES AND COMFORT PROGRAMS THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF WHATCOM HOSPICE, A PROGRAM OF PEACEHEALTH ST. JOSEPH'S MEDICAL CENTER.
IRS990.Desc: SUPPORT FOR WHATCOM HOSPICE, A PROGRAM OF PEACEHEALTH ST. JOSEPH MEDICAL CENTER, TO ASSIST THE PUBLIC IN GAINING ACCESS TO APPROPRIATE HOSPICE CARE, SUPPORT HOSPICE EDUCATION, UNDER-REIMBURSED CARE, BEREAVEMENT, HOME RESPITE, THERAPIES AND COMFORT PROGRAMS. WHATCOM HOSPICE HOUSE SERVES 125 PATIENTS EVERY DAY. HOSPICE PROFESSIONALS WORK WITH BOTH PATIENTS AND THEIR LOVED ONES TO CREATE INDIVIDUALIZED PLANS OF CARE WHICH ENABLE PATIENTS AND THEIR LOVED ONES TO LIVE THE FINAL DAYS OF THEIR LIVES COMFORTABLY AND PAIN FREE, WITH DIGNITY, PURPOSE AND PEACE. THE FOUNDATION RECEIVES FROM PEACEHEALTH ST. JOSEPH MEDICAL CENTER AND PEACEHEALTH CORPORATION DONATED FACILITIES, WHICH INCLUDE SPACE RENTAL, PROPERTY AND EQUIPMENT, UTILITIES AND EMPLOYEE SERVICES. THE ESTIMATED FAIR MARKET VALUE OF $600,951 OF SUCH ITEMS HAS BEEN REFLECTED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS A PART OF IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS AND EXPENSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IF NEEDED THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER MAINTENANCE COSTS OF THE HOSPICE HOUSE AND/OR PROGRAM SUPPORT.

FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, MANAGEMENT OF THE FOUNDATION BELIEVES THAT THERE HAS BEEN NO ACTIVITY THAT WOULD JEOPARDIZE THE TAX POSITION, BEING A TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATION, AND THAT IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT, BASED ON TECHNICAL MERITS, THAT THIS POSITION WOULD BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION. THE FOUNDATION RECOGNIZES INTEREST AND PENALTIES, IF ANY, RELATED TO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS IN INTEREST EXPENSE. THERE WERE NONE FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSE NETTED WITH REVENUE 75,714. CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST 3,239.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSE NETTED WITH REVENUE 75,714.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: PEACEHEALTH ST JOSEPH MEDICAL CENTER FOUNDATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS FOR APPROVING GRANTS: 1. WITHIN THE PLAN OF CARE FOR A GIVEN HOSPICE PATIENT, THE SOCIAL WORKER AND HOSPICE PROGRAM MANAGER DISCUSS THE NEED FOR RESPITE CARE AND APPROVE A CERTAIN NUMBER OF HOURS. 2. THE SERVICE IS MONITORED BY SOCIAL WORKERS AND HOSPICE NURSES. 3. THE HOSPICE OFFICE TEAM LEADER REVIEWS PATIENT BILLINGS AND SUBMITS THEM TO THE FOUNDATION FOR PAYMENT.
THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE ANY PAID EMPLOYEES/BOARD MEMBERS. PEACEHEALTH, AN UNRELALTED ORGANIZATION DOES COMPENSATE EMPLOYEES. PEACEHEALTH HAS A FORMAL COMPENSATION REVIEW POLICY.

ANNE RASMUSSEN RECEIVES COMPENSATION FROM AN UNRELATED ORGANIZATION, PEACEHEALTH, FOR SERVICES PROVIDED TO THE WHATCOM HOSPICE FOUNDATION AS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. ANNE'S COMPENSATION FOR THE 2017 CALENDAR YEAR IS AS FOLLOWS: $193,277 REPORTABLE COMPENSATION $17,986 NON-TAXABLE BENEFITS AND DEFERRED COMPENSATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BY LAWS WERE AMENDED AS OF AUGUST 16, 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE FORM 990 AND A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED BY EMAIL TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS, OFFICERS, AGENTS AND EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN ANNUALLY, OUR IN-DEPTH CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE POLICY WHICH AFFIRMS THEY HAVE READ, UNDERSTOOD AND AGREED WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND HAVE ANSWERED ALL QUESTIONS ON THE DISCLOSURE FULLY AND HONESTLY. THE OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AGENTS AND EMPLOYEES ARE COVERED UNDER THE POLICY. EACH BOARD MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO SIGN AN ELECTRONIC COPY WHICH IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. IT MUST BE SIGNED BEFORE THEY ATTEND ANY BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETINGS. BEFORE AN ITEM IS PUT ON AN AGENDA THE BOARD/COMMITTEE ASCERTAIN IF THERE WILL BE ANY CONFLICTS WITH OUR BOARD AND IF SO, THE BOARD MEMBER IS CONTACTED AND TOLD ABOUT THE SUBJECT OF DISCUSSION. THE BOARD/COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE CONFLICT AND DECIDES IF IT IS IN FACT A CONFLICT AND IF SO, THE PERSON WITH THE CONFLICT IS ASKED TO EXCUSE THEMSELVES FROM THE ROOM DURING DISCUSSION AND VOTING BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OR COMMITTEE CHAIR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS COMPENSATED BY PEACEHEALTH (AN UNRELATED ORGANIZATION) WHICH USES A MARKET BASED COMPENSATION PROGRAM UTILIZING SEVERAL INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTY COMPENSATION MARKET SURVEYS TO ESTABLISH PAY RANGES FOR THE POSITION. PEACEHEALTH THEN ESTABLISHES THE INDIVIDUAL RATE OF PAY WITHIN THE PAY RANGE BASED ON RELEVANT EXPERIENCE/SKILLS/COMPETENCE TO DO THE JOB. THIS RATE OFFERED TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AT TIME OF HIRE WAS DETERMINED THROUGH A DISCUSSION BETWEEN THE REGIONAL DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES AND THE ADMINISTRATIVE DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES. THE RANGES OF PAY ARE REVIEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST 3,239.
